articles.description: Chef José Andrés is once again feeding people in need.

articles.author: Paul R. La Monica, CNN Business
articles.title: Time after time, the US stock market has been unfazed by civil unrest
articles.description: It's not a surprise that stocks mostly rallied Wednesday and were up again Thursday morning, despite the ugly and tragic events during a riot at the nation's Capitol. It's simply a case of history repeating itself.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: No, the Trump fever hasn't broken in his Republican fan club
articles.description: You might think that after violent insurrectionists egged on by Donald Trump stormed and commandeered the Capitol on Wednesday that Republicans might, finally, disavow the President's wild fantasies about how he actually won the election in a "landslide."
articles.content:
THE POINT -- NOW ON YOUTUBE! 
In each episode of his weekly YouTube show, Chris Cillizza will delve a little deeper into the surreal world of politics. Click to subscribe!

articles.title: How the 25th Amendment removes a president
articles.description: CNN's Laura Coates explains how President Donald Trump could be removed under the 25th Amendment. CNN's John Harwood says while the removal of the President is unlikely, any talk of invoking the amendment is meant to send a signal to the rest of the world.
